description.narrative: The project will enable the village to take the necessary steps toward establishing organic gardens to enhance the village's food sovereignty and sustainability. Funds will be spent to build the infrastructure for the gardens, including fencing to protect plants from animals, tools, netted wire for rearing chickens, the construction of a culvert and access road, sanitation, terracing, water supply, etc. Funds will be used to buy seedlings so that fields destroyed by recent cyclones can be replanted. The main crops that will be planted include coconuts, breadfruit, banana, cocoa, coffee trees, taro, yams and other vegetables. There will be a capacity building dimension incorporated into this project that will focus on traditional and contemporary systems of land management.
